div.h2: Employees with EPC Anthem Health Care Plans

div.span: As we all adjust and adapt to the changing landscape, we want to help you access your plan
benefits while still practicing “social distancing," amongst the current COVID-19 pandemic and the State of Ohio's quarantine.
All of our vendor partners have online and
mobile capabilities. If you haven’t signed up or downloaded the apps, now would be a great
ou will find the website and mobile app information for our health plan
partners below under the "Resources" section. Please revise
to match your districts benefit options. COVID-19 testing,
and the associated visit for the testing, will be covered at no cost for PPO
THERE WILL BE NO COST for telemedicine from now until June 14. This includes
Anthem’s LiveHealth Online and other telemedicine options, such as a virtual visit with your
treating physician. This will apply to HSA plans, as well as PPO plans.
Online you have the option of having a virtual office visit with a licensed medical or behavioral
health professional. It is vital that we stay at home in order to do our part to flatten the curve,
but equally important to continue with your care. This option will keep you safe from exposure
and also preserve much needed supplies during this national medical emergency.

span.span: - Anthem is making their Employee Assistance Plan (EAP) website available for all Anthem members. This does not include telephonic or counseling sessions. The site can be accessed at AnthemEAP.com. Click on the log-in button and enter: EAP Can Help.

– Our UNUM basic life plan includes an Employee Assistance Plan (EAP) for help with all sorts of life’s issues, including resources for mental health, legal help and community resources. Attached is the basic EAP flyer.
– Delta Dental is adding coverage for tele-dentistry. The attached flyer outlines how it works.

– VSP is adding essential medical eye care to the plans for the month of April. Yu can see your VSP provider for medical eye issues and it will be covered under VSP. See the attached flyer for details.

p.style: margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; background-image: initial; background-size: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial
p.span: – The CARES Act allows members to use their medical FSA & HRA accounts to pay for over-the-counter medications without requiring a prescription. This change is effective for purchases made back to January 1, 2020.

p.style: margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; background-image: initial; background-size: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial
margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; background-image: initial; background-size: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial
p.span: - The CARES Act allows members to use their HSA accounts to pay for over-the-counter medications without requiring a prescription. This change is effective for purchases made back to January 1, 2020.

div.span: Anthem has a dedicated website available for COVID-19 resources -

a.span: Click Here to View Anthem's COVID-19 Resources webpage

div.span: diligently following all changes and updates, in order to provide you with the

span.text-node: We understand that this is a very challenging time for our
members and we are here to support you. Please do not hesitate to reach out to a member of
the EPC Benefits Team for assistance. Stay healthy!

div.div: In accordance with State and Federal law, Springboro Community City Schools will provide reasonable accommodations to persons with disabilities who wish to attend and/or participate in school events. Such individuals should notify the Superintendent if they require a reasonable accommodation.
